name: TypeNotPresentException
comment:
Thrown when an application tries to access a type using a string representing the type's name, but no definition for the type with the specified name can be found. This exception differs from {@link ClassNotFoundException} in that ClassNotFoundException is a checked exception, whereas this exception is unchecked.

Note that this exception may be used when undefined type variables are accessed as well as when types (e.g., classes, interfaces or annotation types) are loaded. In particular, this exception can be thrown by the {@linkplain java.lang.reflect.AnnotatedElement API used to read annotations reflectively}.

constructors.name: TypeNotPresentException
constructors.comment:
Constructs a <tt>TypeNotPresentException</tt> for the named type
 with the specified cause.

methods.name: typeName
methods.comment: Returns the fully qualified name of the unavailable type.
